t: For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
Truly*pn my soul finds rest in God; my*ld salvation comes from him.
Truly*ln he is my rock and my salvation; he*ld is my fortress, I will never be shaken.
How*pn long will you assault me? Would*ld all of you throw me down— this*ld leaning wall, this tottering fence?
Surely*ln they intend to topple me from*ld my lofty place; they*ld take delight in lies. With*ln their mouths they bless, but*ld in their hearts they curse.
Yes,*pn my soul, find rest in God; my*ld hope comes from him.
Truly*ln he is my rock and my salvation; he*ld is my fortress, I will not be shaken.
My*ln salvation and my honor depend on God; he*ld is my mighty rock, my refuge.
Trust*ln in him at all times, you people; pour*ld out your hearts to him, for*ld God is our refuge.
Surely*pn the lowborn are but a breath, the*ld highborn are but a lie. If*ln weighed on a balance, they are nothing; together*ld they are only a breath.
Do*ln not trust in extortion or*ld put vain hope in stolen goods; though*ln your riches increase, do*ld not set your heart on them.
One*pn thing God has spoken, two*ld things I have heard: “Power*ln belongs to you, God,
and*ld with you, Lord, is unfailing love”; and,*ln “You reward everyone according*ld to what they have done.”
